message: @MarkBennett noted... I shall skip that one too then. Going to give Locomotive another quick try for today's CMS setup I think.
Locomotive is pretty slick, but has less per-user controls  (at this point)  but does benefit from multiple site management vs a separate app per-site.
I'm wondering what client-friendly CMS's the group may have tried & embraced. We currently use BrowserCMS, but it can be a little complicated for basic CMS needs.

RadiantCMS (http://radiantcms.org/) has been around for ages but as it 's an entire Rails app it can be more than most people want/need. I've started testing NestaCMS (http://nestacms.com/) with the new YEGRB site and have been happy so far.
@MarkBennett radiant is too simple for our end-users. We need some WYSIWIG and file/image uploading. I'll check out nesta however

@SeanOuimet NestaCMS is probably too simple as well. It's Sinatra based and stores all content in git. It's similair to the way Jekyll works but allows some server side processing unlike the static pages jekyll generates.
@SeanOuimet I think I may have missed the words "client-friendly" in this post.
I haven't used it, but there's also refinery (http://refinerycms.com)
@MarkBennett Take a look at Toto or Serious - they're similar to Nesta.
@mm3bar could you link Serious – I haven't been able to find it by googling.
I use Refinery for all of my (admittedly, few) client CMS projects - it's great.
